commit.message:
Do not list the same GPU process more than once (#84)

* Do not list the same GPU process more than once

A single process might appear in both of graphics and compute running
processes list (#18). In such cases, the same process (same PID)
would appear appearing twice. We fix this bug: list a process only once.

* Add comments for seen_pids

Co-authored-by: Kaiyu Shi <skyisno.1@gmail.com>

Do not list the same GPU process more than once (#84)

* Do not list the same GPU process more than once

A single process might appear in both of graphics and compute running
processes list (#18). In such cases, the same process (same PID)
would appear appearing twice. We fix this bug: list a process only once.

* Add comments for seen_pids

commit.message:
Bugfix on the --color behavior when TERM is missing

In some cases where the TERM environment variable is missing,
the `--color` option was not working because blessed would try to
resolve as a dumb terminal  (e.g. `ssh <NODE> gpustat --color`).

To make sure the `--color` option always print ANSI color codes,
we specify the default TERM value 'xterm-256color'.
Fix broken tests on python 3.4
Fix broken tests on python 3.4 due to pytest version

Refactoring of test cases using pytest

- Replace unittest with pytest to have more advanced functionality
- Replace unittest's MagicMock with mockito
  (which provides us with more readable and clean stubbing syntax)

- Different stubbing scenarios are implemented using fixtures
- Add verify statements for scenario_nonexistent_pid

- Clean up python2 related stuffs (skipIf, six, etc.)

json: When process information is unavailable, expose as null

The `processes` field of GPUStat as json is changed to be `null`
instead of a string (NOT_SUPPORTED) when process information is not
available.

Refs: #45, #10
Workaround for failing tests on Windows environment
Fix wrong colors for power_draw when power_limit is unavailable
Add tests for various command line options
Update changelog for the --show-codec feature (#79, #80)

Merge pull request #80 from ChaoticMind/enc_dec_util

Add support for enc/dec gpu utilization (#79)

commit.message: Add command-line support for enc/dec gpu utilization
Add support for enc/dec gpu utilization (#79)
Update Changelog for v1.0
Merge branch 'blessed': Add windows support

Travis CI: Add windows build

- Require blessed >= 1.17.1  (necessary for windows CI envs)
- Fix miscellaneous windows hassles around line-ending and encoding

Code cleanup after #78 and tweak on blessed usage

- To prevent blinking cursors, do not re-store cursor locations
- Workaround sgr0 character issues (#32) again
- Misc: various style cleanups

Add windows support with blessed (#78)

- Use blessed (replacing blessings) for windows support
- Handle corner cases of signal handling, query_time, and gpu_memory_usage

commit.message: Travis: Add python 3.8

Add unit test for CLI options

* -a, --show-all (#64)
* --color (#32: should work well with legacy watch)
Add '-a' argument for showing all gpu properties (#64)

Rename package: gpustat.__main__ -> gpustat.cli

This is to avoid a warning about module import order (e.g.
gpustat.__main__ found after import of package gpustat, but prior to
execution of gpustat.__main__).

- gpustat.cli.main (Aliased to gpustat.main)
- gpustat.cli.print_gpustat (Aliased to gpustat.print_gpustat)

Do not run flake8 checker on travis CI

PEP8 styles are good, but should be encouraged rather than
strictly enforced.

Minor improvements on full process info (#65, #50)

- Introduce gpustat.util for misc util functions.
- Use a less attractive color (dark blue-ish) for full process info,
  with basename of the command (as per `-p`) colored differently.
- Small refactoring for better coding practices.

Add full process information (#65)

Add -f, --show-full-cmd that show the full process info as discussed in #50.

Print degrees with correct symbol (#58)

Use degree symbol instead of apostrophe when printing temperature.

Remove support for Python 2 (#67)

Conflicts:
	setup.py
Update README and CHANGELOG
Bump to next development version: 1.0.0.dev0
Release version v0.6.0
